IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO CONNECT PEOPLE WITH QUALITY GIVING AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES WORLDWIDE
IRS990.MissionDesc: UNIVERSALGIVING'S MISSION IS TO CONNECT PEOPLE TO QUALITY GIVING AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES WORLDWIDE. UNIVERSALGIVING IS A 501(C)3 NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION, WHOSE VISION IS TO CREATE A WORLD WHERE GIVING AND VOLUNTEERING ARE A NATURAL PART OF EVERYDAY LIFE."
IRS990.Desc: UNIVERSALGIVING HELPS ORGANIZATIONS ALL AROUND THE WORLD ACCESS RESOURCES BY CONNECTING DONORS AND VOLUNTEERS TO VETTED NGOS AND THEIR PROJECTS IN AN EFFICIENT AND TRANSPARENT MANNER. UNIVERSALGIVING'S WEBSITE (WWW.UNIVERSALGIVING.ORG) PROVIDES A FREE PUBLIC SERVICE WHERE USERS CAN SELECT AMONG HUNDREDS OF VOLUNTEER AND DONATION OPPORTUNITIES TO HELP PEOPLE IN NEED, SUCH AS TEACHING COMPUTER LITERACY IN GHANA, OR MAKING A $50 DONATION TO PROVIDE FRESH FRUIT TO 100 ORPHANS IN NEPAL. UNIVERSALGIVING DOES NOT TAKE A CUT: 100% OF EVERY DONATION MADE TO OUR PARTNER NGOS GOES DIRECTLY TO THE CAUSE. WE WANT OUR SERVICE TO BE FREE TO THE PUBLIC AND IT HAS BEEN SINCE WE BEGAN IN 2002. UNIVERSALGIVING'S SERVICES HAVE BEEN FEATURED ON NEW YORK TIMES, CBS NEWS, OPRAH.COM, THE CHRONICLE OF PHILANTHROPY, MOTHER JONES, CNNMONEY, AND BUSINESS WEEK. UNIVERSALGIVING SUPPORTS SMALL, TOP-PERFORMING NGOS IN CRISIS STRICKEN COUNTRIES. THESE NGOS SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACT THEIR COMMUNITIES, BUT ARE THEMSELVES LARGELY UNKNOWN. WE HAVE 200 PUBLISHED ORGANIZATIONS ON THE SITE AND THOUSANDS ACCESSIBLE IN OUR DATABASE, DEPENDING ON THE CRISIS OR DONOR REQUEST. OUR NGO PARTNERS WORK IN OVER 170 COUNTRIES AND TERRITORIES IN THE AREAS OF HEALTH, EDUCATION, TECHNOLOGY, WAR PREVENTION, ANIMAL RIGHTS, POVERTY ALLEVIATION, COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AND SUSTAINABILITY, AND DISASTER RELIEF. UNIVERSALGIVING VETS EACH NONPROFIT NGO ON OUR WEBSITE WITH OUR QUALITY MODEL, A RIGOROUS 24 STAGE PROCESS. WE ENSURE THAT OUR USERS CAN GIVE AND VOLUNTEER WITH A TRUSTED, QUALITY ORGANIZATION. UNIVERSALGIVING SERVES NUMEROUS DIVERSE DONORS AND VOLUNTEERS OF ALL AGES, BACKGROUNDS, AND ECONOMIC STATUS. THIS YEAR ALONE WE VETTED 1,050 NGOS FOR INDIVIDUALS, DONORS, CORPORATIONS, CORPORATE EMPLOYEES, EMPLOYEE VOLUNTEERS AND FOUNDATIONS. UNIVERSALGIVING ANNUALLY FACILITATES NEARLY $3.8 MILLION IN U.S. DOLLARS AND $2.9 AUSTRALIAN DOLLARS IN SMALL, MICRO DONATIONS, MUCH OF IT FROM SMALL DONATIONS OF $5-$15. WE WANT TO MAKE GIVING ACCESSIBLE TO PEOPLE OF ALL AGES AND INCOMES. UNIVERSALGIVING IS ALSO VERY POPULAR FOR GIVING DONATIONS TO CRISIS EVENTS, SUCH AS PROVIDING RELIEF TO HURRICANE HARVEY VICTIMS. OUR CRISIS RELIEF FUND IS A VALUABLE RESOURCE FOR THOSE WANTING TO GIVE TO LOCAL NGOS IN TIMES OF CRISIS. AS PART OF UNIVERSALGIVING'S PUBLIC SERVICE WE ALSO HAVE A DONATE/TIP FEATURE ON OUR WEBSITE THAT ALLOWS VISITORS TO GIVE A TIP TO UNIVERSALGIVING TO SUPPORT OUR WORK. MANY DONORS CHOOSE TO SUPPORT UNIVERSALGIVING IN THE FORM OF A SMALL TIP, TYPICALLY $15. WHEN THEY VISIT OUR WEBSITE, THEY DO SO BECAUSE THEY SUPPORT OUR FREE SERVICE, WHICH HELPS PEOPLE GIVE AND VOLUNTEER ALL OVER THE WORLD.CRITICAL TO OUR MISSION IS OUR VOLUNTEERING SERVICE. WE HELP VOLUNTEERS IN MORE THAN 170 COUNTRIES, WHICH HAS INCREASED 13% SINCE LAST YEAR. TESTIMONIALS OF OUR VOLUNTEER SERVICES INCLUDE A MOM WITH THREE TEENAGE KIDS WHO VOLUNTEERED IN COSTA RICA WITH THE FOUNDATION FOR MEDICAL RELIEF OF CHILDREN; AND A FATHER SEEKING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR HIS FAMILY IN HIS HOMETOWN AND INTERNATIONALLY. ANOTHER VOLUNTEER TESTIMONIAL WAS FROM A 30-PERSON HIGH SCHOOL CLASS, WHICH VOLUNTEERED IN GREECE, USING ART TO SUPPORT THE ELDERLY WITH ALZHEIMERS AND DEMENTIA. IN 2015, UNIVERSALGIVING FACILITATED MORE THAN 3,146 VOLUNTEER REFERRALS, OUR HIGHEST NUMBER TO DATE IN TOTAL. WE HAVE EMPOWERED MORE THAN 18,000 VOLUNTEERS TO HELP WITH PROJECTS FOR COMMUNITIES IN NEED ALL OVER THE WORLD. STUDENTS, FAMILIES, AND RETIREES USE UNIVERSALGIVING TO FIND MEANINGFUL TRIPS THAT SERVE THE IMPOVERISHED. JUST THIS YEAR ALONE WE HAVE FACILITATED MORE THAN $97,600 WORTH OF VOLUNTEER HOURS CONTRIBUTED. INDEPENDENT SECTOR VALUES THE VOLUNTEER HOUR AT $20.00 PER HOUR AND A TRIP IS ON AVERAGE TWO WEEKS. WE HAVE FACILITATED MORE THAN 32 MILLION WORTH OF VOLUNTEER HOURS OVER OUR EXISTENCE. THIS IS AN EXTREMELY CONSERVATIVE ESTIMATE, SINCE MANY OF OUR VOLUNTEERS VOLUNTEER FOR MONTHS OR EVEN YEARS AT A TIME.OUR TOP NGO PARTNERS IN 2017 WERE DEVELOP AFRICA, OPERATION USA, GLOBE AWARE, WORLDTEACH, AND THE GVN FOUNDATION. DEVELOP AFRICA FACILITATES SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT IN AFRICA THROUGH CAPACITY BUILDING AND TRANSFORMATIONAL EDUCATION. IN 2017, DEVELOP AFRICA RECEIVED $1,245 IN DONATIONS FROM UNIVERSALGIVING. OPERATION USA SUPPORTS HEALTH AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS IN ORDER TO HELP CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN THE US AND ABROAD RECOVER IN THE WAKE OF DISASTERS, DISEASE, VIOLENCE AND POVERTY. OPERATION USA RECEIVED $600 IN DONATIONS FROM UNIVERSALGIVING IN 2017. GLOBE AWARE PROMOTES CULTURAL AWARENESS AND SUSTAINABILITY THROUGH SHORT TERM VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS AROUND THE WORLD. UNIVERSALGIVING FACILITATED 99 VOLUNTEER REFERRALS FOR GLOBE AWARE IN 2017. WORLDTEACH IS AN NGO THAT PARTNERS WITH GOVERNMENTS AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER TEACHERS TO MEET LOCAL NEEDS AND PROMOTE RESPONSIBLE GLOBAL CITIZENSHIP. WORLDTEACH RECEIVED 16 VOLUNTEER REFERRALS FROM UNIVERSALGIVING IN 2017. THE GVN FOUNDATION SUPPORTS LOCAL COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN VARIOUS COUNTRIES THROUGH ORGANIZING VOLUNTEER TRIPS AS WELL AS THROUGH THE DISTRIBUTION OF FINANCIAL, IN KIND AND MATERIAL DONATIONS. AS ONE OF THE MOST POPULAR VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES, THE GVN FOUNDATION OFFERS ON UNIVERSALGIVING VOLUNTEERING WITH CHILDREN IN THE PHILIPPINES. VOLUNTEERS HELP COMMUNITY EFFORTS TO PROVIDE NUTRITION, HOUSING, EDUCATION, HEALTH CARE, AND OTHER SERVICES TO SURVIVORS OF TYPHOON HAIYAN. IN 2017, GCN RECEIVED 163 VOLUNTEER REFERRALS FROM THE UNIVERSALGIVING WEBSITE. OUR GOAL IS TO SUPPORT MILLIONS OF NGOS ALL OVER THE WORLD IN A SIMILAR WAY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: UNIVERSALGIVING PARTNERS WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS IN SUPPORT OF UNIVERSALGIVING'S MISSION TO INCREASE GIVING AND VOLUNTEERING BY PROMOTING OUR VETTED NGO PARTNERS AND THEIR PROJECTS. WE ARE EXPANDING THE REACH OF OUR NGO PARTNERS AND THEIR DESERVING CAUSES BY BUILDING RELATIONSHIPS WITH INDIVIDUAL PHILANTHROPISTS, CORPORATIONS, FOUNDATIONS, AND UNIVERSITIES THAT SHARE OUR GOAL OF HELPING PEOPLE AROUND THE WORLD. SOME PARTNERSHIPS FROM 2017 INCLUDE UNIVERSITIES, SUCH AS HARVARD, THAT PROVIDE LINKS TO OUR WEBSITE AND INTERNSHIP AND RETURNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES. OTHER PARTNERSHIPS INCLUDE FORBES AND FORBES NONPROFIT COUNCIL, WHERE OUR CEO IS A PHILANTHROPY EXPERT HELPING PEOPLE LEARN ABOUT PHILANTHROPY, SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND HOW TO DONATE OR VOLUNTEER. A SIMILAR PARTNERSHIP IS WITH CHRISTIAN SCIENCE MONITOR WHERE SHE IS ALSO A PHILANTHROPY EXPERT. THEY FEATURE ARTICLES AND ADVICE FROM OUR CEO ON PHILANTHROPY, AND IN OUR ARTICLES, WE FEATURE OUR NGO PARTNERS. UNVIERSALGIVING'S ARTICLES ARE PUBLISHED ON FORBES AND CHRISTIAN SCIENCE MONITOR TWICE A MONTH. UNIVERSALGIVING'S CEO ALSO WRITES DAILY ON TOPICS OF GLOBAL PHILANTHROPY AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY FOR SEECHANGE MAGAZINE, FAST COMPANY AND CSRWIRE. WE WERE ALSO PUBLISHED WITH ARTICLES ABOUT OUR NGOS IN TRIPLE PUNDIT, GLASS CEILING, AND DUKE I&E'S INITIATIVE DEAR PAMELA. OTHER PARTNERSHIPS INCLUDE SOCAP, WOMEN 2.0, AND AMAZONSMILE. UNIVERSALGIVING ALSO WORKS WITH SYNERGOS, A GROUP OF HIGH-NET WORTH DONORS HELPING THEM GIVE BACK TO SOCIETY IN MORE THAN 40 COUNTRIES AROUND THE WORLD. ALL OF THE THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE BRINGING NEW DONORS AND VOLUNTEERS TO HUNDREDS OF OUR NGO PARTNERS. WE ARE CONSISTENTLY PIONEERING NEW INNOVATIVE WAYS TO HELP THE WORLD, SUCH AS MEDIAGIVES. MEDIAGIVES IS WHERE WE PARTNER WITH MEDIA ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE GIVING AND VOLUNTEERING. CHRISTIAN SCIENCE MONITOR IS ONE OF OUR TOP MEDIAGIVES PARTNERS THROUGH THEIR "PEOPLE MAKING A DIFFERENCE" ARTICLES. AFTER SOMEONE IS INSPIRED BY READING AN ARTICLE OR WATCHING A VIDEO ABOUT PHILANTHROPY, A LINK IS PROVIDED FOR THEM TO GIVE AND VOLUNTEER ON UNIVERSALGIVING. FOR EXAMPLE, AFTER THEY READ AN ARTICLE ABOUT A CRISIS IN SUDAN THEY CAN THEN TAKE ACTION THROUGH UNIVERSALGIVING AND DONATE OR VOLUNTEER WITH ONE OF OUR NGO PARTNERS IN SUDAN. MEDIAGIVES PARTNERSHIPS PROMOTE HUNDREDS OF OUR NGO PARTNERS, MAKING THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE MORE AWARE OF THEIR DESERVING CAUSES. THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE ALSO TAKE ACTION AND GIVE OR VOLUNTEER, THUS INCREASING THE ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY OF OUR PARTNERS. WE ALSO WORK WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, HELPING THEM PROMOTE AND FACILITATE GIVING THROUGH PUBLIC SPEAKING EVENTS. THUS, UNIVERSALGIVING FURTHERS ITS MISSION AND HELPS OUR INDUSTRY AND THE PHILANTHROPIC COMMUNITY. OUR CEO, PAMELA HAWLEY, SPEAKS ON SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY AT MANY EVENTS AND VENUES INCLUDING STANFORD AND DUKE UNIVERSITY WHERE SHE DISCUSSED SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP, QUALITY PHILANTHROPY, AND UNIVERSALGIVING'S MISSION. ADDITIONALLY, UNIVERSALGIVING HAS A NEWSLETTER THAT GOES TO 40,000 CONTACTS. NEWSLETTER CONTENT IS DEVOTED TO GLOBAL CAUSES AND FEATURES OUR NGO PARTNERS AND THEIR INITIATIVES. A GLOBAL TEAM SENDS OUT OUR NEWSLETTER WITH THE MOST PRESSING CAUSES AND INFORMATION ON PHILANTHROPY. THE CEO ALSO HAS A BLOG CALLED LIVING AND GIVING (HTTP://PAMELAHAWLEY.WORDPRESS.COM). LIVING AND GIVING'S MISSION IS TO "INSPIRE LEADERS TO LIVE WITH EXCELLENCE AND LOVE," WHICH SUPPORTS LEADERS ALL ACROSS THE WORLD ON A GLOBAL LEVEL, INCLUDING GLOBAL LEADERSHIP AND ETHICS, HOW TO ADDRESS GLOBAL CRISES, GLOBAL ECONOMICS IN IMPOVERISHED COUNTRIES AND HOW TO TAKE ACTION TO SUPPORT THESE CAUSES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: UNIVERSALGIVING REGULARLY PARTNERS WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, PROVIDING OUR SERVICES TO HELP THEM GIVE AND VOLUNTEER WITH TOP-PERFORMING NONPROFITS. ONE OF THE BEST WAYS WE DO THIS IS HELP COMPANIES, THEIR EMPLOYEES OR FOUNDATIONS KNOW WHICH NGOS TO GIVE TO. UNIVERSALGIVING LEVERAGES ITS EXPERTISE AND CORE COMPETENCY OF VETTING NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND PROJECTS TO RECOMMEND NGOS FOR FUNDING TO CORPORATE FOUNDATIONS AND TO DONORS. THEREFORE, WE PROVIDE MORE VALUE TO CORPORATIONS, EMPLOYEES, EMPLOYEE VOLUNTEERS AND DONORS AS THEY CAN BE ENSURED THEIR FUNDS ARE GOING TO THE BEST NGOS. FOR EXAMPLE, WE HELPED A COMPANY DONATE BACKPACKS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO SCHOOL CHILDREN AMIDST A CIVIL WAR IN GUINEA. NO OTHER FOUNDATION OR DONOR ADVISED FUND WOULD TAKE ON THE PROJECT AND WE FOUND A LOCAL NGO TO ACHIEVE THE COMPANY'S VISION. WE HELP OUR NGOS BY PRESENTING THEM TO COMPANIES FOR THEIR CORPORATE SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY PROGRAMS. THIS INCREASES AWARENESS ABOUT THESE NGOS, HELPS THEM WITH FUNDING AND HELPS THEM WITH MORE CORPORATE VOLUNTEERS. THE SAME HOLDS TRUE IN OUR WORK WITH UNIVERSITIES, FOUNDATIONS AND DONORS. BY ENSURING THESE ENTITIES' GIVING AND VOLUNTEER IS EFFECTIVE, WE ARE FURTHER BROADENING UNIVERSALGIVING'S MISSION TO "CONNECT PEOPLE WITH QUALITY GIVING AND VOLUNTEERING OPPORTUNITIES AROUND THE WORLD." SOME COMPANY PARTNERS IN 2017 INCLUDE CISCO, RSF SOCIAL FINANCE, BHP, AND GAP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY DELOITTE TAX LLP, AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM. IT IS THEN REVIEWED BY UNVERSALGIVING'S CEO, COO, AND MANAGER OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCE. IT IS THEN PASSED OFF TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE ON THE UNVERSALGIVING BOARD, WHO REVIEWS IT TO ENSURE THE HIGHEST QUALITY, DETAIL, AND THOROUGHNESS, AS WELL AS TO ENSURE IT REPRESENTS OUR MISSION AND ACTIVITIES WITH CLARITY. A COMPLETE COPY OF FORM 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF THE BOARD, OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES MUST DISCLOSE ETHICAL, LEGAL, FINANCIAL OR OTHER CONFLICTS OF INTEREST INVOLVING UNIVERSALGIVING, AND REMOVE THEMSELVES FROM A POSITION OF DECISION-MAKING AUTHORITY WITH RESPECT TO ANY CONFILCT SITUATION INVOLVING THE ORGANIZATION. IF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DETERMINES THAT AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST DOES EXIST, THE BOARD SHALL ALSO DETERMINE AN APPROPRIATE REMEDY. SUCH REMEDY MAY INCLUDE, FOR EXAMPLE, THE RECUSAL OF THE CONFLICTED INDIVIDUAL FROM PARTICIPATING IN CERTAIN MATTERS PENDING BEFORE THE BOARD OR OTHER UG BODY OR THE REMOVAL FROM THE ORGANIZATION OR THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION IS BASED ON COMPARABLE DATA FOR NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS FROM THE COUNCIL OF FOUNDATIONS REPORT, GRANTMAKERS SALARY AND BENEFITS REPORT, AND ALSO CROSS REFERENCED WITH SMALL AND MID-SIZE COMPANIES IN SILICON VALLEY. IN OUR EFFORTS TO BE FAIR AND COMPETITIVE IT IS PREPARED CONSISTENTLY BY OUR COO AND IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE OFFICERS AND THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. UNIVERSALGIVING IS PROVIDED COMPENSATION THAT IS ON PAR OR A BIT BELOW THE AVERAGE COMPENSATION FOR THE SIZE OR OUT ORGANIZATION IN CALIFORNIA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES, AND FORM 990S ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST FOR THE PERIOD OF TIME SET FORTH IN IRC SEC 6104. REQUESTS SHOULD BE SUBMITTED IN WRITING AND SENT TO OUR OFFICE AT 901 MISSION STREET, SUITE 205, SAN FRANCISCO, CA 94103, ALONG WITH A POSTAGE PAID, SELF-ADDRESSED ENVELOPE. POLICIES AVAILABLE INCLUDE AMONG OTHERS - CONFLICT OF INTEREST, DOCUMENT RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION, GIFT ACCEPTANCE, PRIVACY POLICY, TERMS AND CONDITIONS, AND WHISTLEBLOWER POLICY.

STRATEGIC MARKETING & CONSULTING: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 4,523. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 2,139. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 6,662. ENGINEERING : PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 55,801.
